org.midica.file

Class ExportResult

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.midica.file.ExportResult

  • public class ExportResult
extends java.lang.Object

    This class is used to collect export warnings for a later display. A MIDI stream can not always be transformed into a MidicaPL source file properly. Warnings regarding such problems are collected and sorted here in order to be displayed later.

    Author:
    Jan Trukenm√ºller

    • Constructor Detail

      • ExportResult

        public ExportResult(boolean success)

        Creator of an empty warning object. Initializes a new empty data structure for warnings.

        Parameters:
        success - false, if the export failed. Otherwise: true.

    • Method Detail

      • addWarning

        public void addWarning(int track,
                       long tick,
                       int channel,
                       int note,
                       java.lang.String msg)

        Adds a new warning message.

        Parameters:
        track - Track number of the event that caused the warning.
        tick - Tickstamp of the event that caused the warning.
        channel - Channel where the warning occured – or -1 if it wasn’t a channel based event.
        note - Note number of the event – or -1 if no note was involved.
        msg - Warning message

      • getWarnings

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String>> getWarnings()

        Returns a data structure containing all warnings, sorted by tick. Each tick where at least one warning occured has an entry. The ArrayList for each tick contains a HashMap for each warning. Each HashMap contains the details of the warning.

        Returns:
        data structure containing all warnings.

      • countWarnings

        public int countWarnings()

        Returns the number of warnings.

        Returns:
        number of warnings.

      • isSuccessful

        public boolean isSuccessful()

        Returns true, if the export was successful, otherwise false.

        Returns:
        true, if the export was successful, otherwise false.
